option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"/Users/erik/IdeaProjects/TableViewEksempel":"{\"/src/main/java/com/example/tablevieweksempel/TableviewExample.java\":\"This file is the main class for a JavaFX application that demonstrates the use of a TableView. It does not contain any additional classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`start(Stage stage)`: This function is the entry point of the JavaFX application, where it loads the FXML file, creates a scene, sets the title and stage, and displays the application.\\n\\n`main(String[] args)`: This function is the main method that launches the JavaFX application.\\n\\n`stop()`: This function is called when the application is stopped, and it prints a message to the console.\",\"/src/main/java/module-info.java\":\"This file appears to be a module declaration for a JavaFX application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather specifies the module\\u0027s dependencies and the packages that should be opened and exported.\\n\\nThe module declaration file serves the following purposes:\\n\\n1. It declares the module name as `com.example.tablevieweksempel`.\\n2. It specifies the required dependencies, which are `javafx.controls` and `javafx.fxml`.\\n3. It opens the `com.example.tablevieweksempel` package to the `javafx.fxml` module, allowing the FXML files to access the classes in this package.\\n4. It exports the `com.example.tablevieweksempel` package, making it accessible to other modules that depend on this module.\",\"/src/main/java/com/example/tablevieweksempel/TableviewExampleController.java\":\"This file contains a JavaFX application that demonstrates the use of a TableView to display and manipulate a list of `Person` objects.\\n\\n`TableviewExampleController`: This class is the controller for the TableView and handles the initialization, sorting, and editing of the data.\\n\\n`initialize()`: This function sets up the TableView, configures the columns, and populates the data.\\n\\n`museklik(MouseEvent event)`: This function handles double-click events on the TableView and opens a modal dialog to edit the selected `Person` object.\\n\\n`erSorteret(SortEvent\\u003cTableView\\u003cPerson\\u003e\\u003e tableViewSortEvent)`: This function is called when the TableView is sorted and prints a message to the console.\\n\\n`fjernLinje(ActionEvent actionEvent)`: This function removes the selected `Person` object from the TableView.\\n\\n`redigerLinje(Person p1)`: This function opens a modal dialog to edit the selected `Person` object and updates the TableView with the new data.\",\"/src/main/java/com/example/tablevieweksempel/Person.java\":\"This file defines a `Person` class that represents a person with an ID and a name. The class is designed to be used with a JavaFX `TableView` component, where the ID and name properties can be easily accessed and displayed.\\n\\n`Person`: A class that represents a person with an ID and a name.\\n\\n`Person(int, String)`: A constructor that creates a new `Person` object with the given ID and name.\\n\\n`getId()`: A getter method that returns the ID of the `Person` object.\\n\\n`getNavn()`: A getter method that returns the name of the `Person` object.\\n\\n`setNavn(String)`: A setter method that sets the name of the `Person` object.\\n\\n`setId(int)`: A setter method that sets the ID of the `Person` object.\",\"/pom.xml\":\"This file is a Maven project configuration file for a JavaFX application called \\\"TableViewEksempel\\\". It defines the project\\u0027s dependencies, build settings, and configuration for running the application.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it provides the following information:\\n\\n`project`: Defines the project\\u0027s metadata, including the group ID, artifact ID, version, and name.\\n\\n`properties`: Defines project-wide properties, such as the source encoding and the version of JUnit to be used.\\n\\n`dependencies`: Specifies the external libraries and frameworks required by the project, including JavaFX controls, JavaFX FXML, and JUnit for testing.\\n\\n`build`: Configures the build process, including the compiler plugin settings and the JavaFX Maven plugin, which is used to package and run the application.\"}"}
